Reviews.Title: “Nothing fancy”
Reviews.Author: trippydory
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the hotel apartment with my friends for 2 nights which is located steps away from the hotelâ€™s concierge. There are two bathrooms and two supposedly bedrooms but the 2nd room is just a sofa bed converted to a bed in the living area. Close to St Markâ€™s Basilica but far from the train station. Took us around 40-50mins to the train station so make sure you leave an hour or more earlier if you have a train to catch. Breakfast is ok, not that much variety. Some staffs are friendly but some are not especially when you stay longer for breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “An ideal stay”
Reviews.Author: SilverFox_8
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed for 4 nights in late March and were delighted with the hotel. The room was a good size and the location of the hotel close to St Mark's Square but well hidden was ideal. I would recommend the hotel to anyone looking for good accomodation at a reasonable price.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient location”
Reviews.Author: CaBuMa
Reviews.Content: In Venice it's not all that easy to find nice but affordable rooms and Hotel Campiello is a good choice for a short stay. It is ideally located and - unlike so many other places - easy to find. San Marco square is very close. Despite it's proximity to this nearby attraction the hotel is in a quiet alley giving you a break from the crowds and the noise. The room was very small but clean. For a tall person the bed may be too short though. Breakfast was not to my liking but for those who like a sweet breakfast it may suffice.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel In Venice Review”
Reviews.Author: glady1955
Reviews.Content: Great location to the main square of Venice. The hotel staff was very average and a few members we not very friendly or helpful in regards to quetions/directions. If you like to sleep past 0700 AM this location is not for you, very noisy outside in the AM with vendors running their carts to the main street area. The breakfast which was included in the price had a very nice selection and service. April 2012.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the apartment”
Reviews.Author: Uluave
Reviews.Content: We traveled in March 2012 with two adults and three children (17, 14, and 10). The apartment was very spacious and immaculately clean. The kitchen was well equipped (we stayed in for dinner two nights and enjoyed using the kitchen and having a long meal together at the dining table). The two bathrooms were amazing - super jet showers with endless hot water. Our girls shared a fold-out bed in the living room and it wasn't perfectly comfortable - but the king size bed and the single bed were fantastic. The hotel is tucked away from the main thoroughfare, and the location is charming and quiet. At the same time, everything was in easy walking distance. Desk staff was helpful and informative; breakfast was plentiful with good service; and, again, the apartment was giant with great bathrooms, which pretty much made it perfect. I would not stay anywhere else in Venice - this place was great.

Reviews.Title: “Venice is gorgeous!!! and Hotel Campiello wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: Marsdengal
Reviews.Content: In November my husband and I spent two nights in the is lovely hotel. It did not have a view which may or may not affect your stay. The room is a tight one but clean and well appointed. I enjoyed a few Bellinis and my hubby a few spritzs... so really .. we didnt notice it was small!! The breakfast was typical fare but they made killer espressos and cappucinos! We felt quite at home here and felt safe with the evening lock up system. Reasonable price for the location... it is just a hop skip jump to Piazza San Marco. The staff were friendly and spoke English very well! We will be back!!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location!”
Reviews.Author: HollyBloor
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in an excellent location! Very easy to get to from the airport and situated right next to Piazza San Marco. The hotel itself (room, breakfast etc) is very basic but i found it more than adequate. The only issue was noise, the walls seemed to be very thin and so, at times, it was very noisy. Overall though it has my complete recommendation.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Aucks67
Reviews.Content: We took the directions from the hotel web site and arrived at the boat stop easily, then walked just a few steps to the hotel. Check in was easy, we were In room T which is located outside the main hotel and in the courtyard which made coming and going easy, only problem was a bit of noise from foot traffic but it wasn't to bad. Breakfast was lovely each morning. We walked everywhere we could possibly find which was good off the tourist tracks. It was great to see the locals in the neighborhood courtyards enjoying the sunshine. We spent 3nights here, room was big, shower was amazing but we were very over Venice after 2 days so we were happy to have such a nice size room and courtyard area to relax in.

Reviews.Title: “Fourth Visit to Venice”
Reviews.Author: jpetrush
Reviews.Content: Fine facility in an excellent location. Only quibbles: dim lighting, mediocre morning coffee (typical of Europe), obnoxious neighbor with very loud TV.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely place for the right price”
Reviews.Author: akbyrd
Reviews.Content: Stayed for a week in January. Super easy to find and conveniently located. The included breakfast was tasty with good service. Best part was the lovely friendly English-speaking staff -- from the first time I emailed them asking about a reservation, they were so responsive and helpful to work with. We depended on them for making dinner and theater reservations, recommending restaurants, and generally advising us. The only downside was that we stayed in the Junior Suite on top floor, i.e. the remodeled attic. Clean, large, adorable, and comfortable... if you're short. Very low ceiling with beams sticking out meant that my 6-foot-tall husband practically gave himself a concussion every day. He actually had a scar on his forehead from one encounter with a sharp-ended beam by the skylight. It was much less of an inconvenience for me at 5 foot 6, but because of the steeply slanted roof, even I banged my head a couple times getting out of bed or while putting clothes in the cupboards at sides of room. I got a glimpse of other rooms on lower floors and of course no such issue there. I have already strongly recommended the hotel to family members who will be traveling to Venice this spring. I'm happy to have stayed there; it was good value for the money; just be cautious about the Junior Suite if there's a tall person involved.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great service”
Reviews.Author: Tmen1965
Reviews.Content: We just returned from 4 days, during Carnevale. We had booked a jr suite and were amazed at the size of the rooms. It even included our own private rooftop terrace, although it was a bit cold for us to use. The staff were kind, accomodating, helpful. Everyone spoke good English. The breakfast was good for a buffet and the staff really hustled to keep everything well stocked and fresh coffee and cappucino made. It is also in a perfect location- only about 3 min from San Marco square, tucked into a quiet area. The only downfall that I can find to this hotel was the "tired" furnishings. Our beds were clean, but hard and a bit saggy. The carpets were stained and worn- but had been vacuumed and were clean. The cabinet door to our fridge was broken and falling off. But even though the room had a "worn out " feeling to it, the hotel over all left a good impression and I would certainly visit again.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: louise3684
Reviews.Content: this hotel was reallly good value for money, location is perfect, it's just out of st marks square and is directly opposite the vaporetto stop for san zaccharia, so great for transport if visiting murano or just hopping between places. The staff are very friendly and helpful, rooms were nice and breakfast was adequate. you even get cappachinos, lattes and espressos made freshly for you. also use of the safe is free and toiletries are provided, rooms were cleaned every day.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: Toronto_JF
Reviews.Content: A bit hard to find at first (particularly if arriving at night) but a really good value. We stayed in during prime season and the hotel did not feel crowded at all. It was very quite at night. The staff wasn't particularly friendly but they were efficient. Our room was comfortable and clean. The location is incredible. San Marco square is about 2 minutes walking distance. Tip - we heard that the Hotel Daniele is gorgeous and eating breakfast from the top floor restaurant is not to be missed....the view was gorgeous and the hotel is so so beautiful. BUT we went thinking "how expensive could breakfast possibly be???".... we paid 130 euros!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay in Venice”
Reviews.Author: dallasbonedoc
Reviews.Content: This hotel was about a 2 minute walk from the S.Zaccaria vaporetto stop and a very short walk from Piazza San Marco as well as all the other sights nearby. Good breakfast, 1 hour free wifi, clean and with helpful English speaking staff. Would definitely stay there again. The rates were also very reasonable since we were there in the offseason (they double or triple in the high season). Overall, the hotel left a good impression and would readily recommend it as place to stay for one or more nights.

Reviews.Title: “trip to venetie”
Reviews.Author: cees s
Reviews.Content: excellent location, comfortable and clean rooms, good serviceT

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location for a Venetian getaway”
Reviews.Author: jb1488
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a fantastic location, literally steps away from the San Zaccaria vaporetto stop and a short walk from St Mark's square. It is in a very narrow street, but its proximity to the vaporetto route makes it much easier to find than other hotels that are further 'inland', given the somewhat confusing nature of Venetian streets. The hotel staff I dealt with were friendly and professional, offering a warm welcome to Venice and the hotel. The room was clean and spacious, and the bed was very comfortable. The area was quiet at night which made sleep easy. My only issue was that there was no curtain completely covering the window, which meant the room wasn't quite dark enough at night - this may be an issue for some, especially in summer months when it gets dark late/light early. Breakfast was included and was standard continental fare - not the best hotel breakfast I've had but a far cry from the worst as well.

Reviews.Title: “Cental located secure hotel”
Reviews.Author: Anne T
Reviews.Content: We are a mature aged couple and found the hotel centrally located with helpful staff. The hotel had a lovely european feel which we appreciated after coming from Australia. The breakfast was excellent with real coffee being offered. We felt most secure and this hotel would be excellent for the women traveller. We look forward to returning to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: suhess
Reviews.Content: Hotel is easy to find- just a few steps from the vaparetto stop. We stayed in the junior suite just to have some extra room and it was great! Wish we could have stayed longer!

Reviews.Title: “Charming, off the cuff”
Reviews.Author: julessandiego43
Reviews.Content: The staff was warm, accommodating and professional. Rate was great (off season and discount with cash and mention of Rick Steve's travel guide) I recommend a room towards the back because our room in the front was above the front iron door which you could hear shutting when people came in and out, and people talking. Also, someone was smoking outside below our window so it started to bother us (x-smoker). We asked if we could be moved the next morning & they went out of their way to do so, trading our room for 1 that had a secret terrace from the window to the 2nd floor, awesome!The 2nd room's bath was painfully smaller but the terrace made up for it all! Nice buffet, excellent location. Love it and will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: cblaisse
Reviews.Content: Ideal location, perfect hotel -good value for money, safe, clean, it has all you need including friendly staff. Will definitely stay at Hotel Campiello again next time I visit!

Reviews.Title: “Close to St. Marks Square”
Reviews.Author: korbt
Reviews.Content: We spent three nights in Hotel Campiello in one of their adjacent apartments which had been totally renovated. All marble bath with wall dividers between the bedroom, kitchen, and living room. We ate breakfast around the corner in the main hotel and it was very good. The hotel also gave us a very good cash rate and were very accommodating for directions and places to eat, The only problem we had was the fact that the shower door would not open all the way due to the way it was constructed. Most people would have any problem, but I am a big person and really had to squeeze!

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly located hotel in Venice”
Reviews.Author: bren53Cork
Reviews.Content: Stayed in Hotel Campiello on first visit to Venice and found it an ideal choice as it was very easy to find as i got the waterbus from the airport and was delighted to find the hotel only a couple hundred yards from San Zaccaria stop also San Marco is only 5 minutes walk. The hotel offer excellent value for such a location in this amazing city. My room had everything that I needed also the room was spotlessly clean and as the hotel is down a side street it is away from any noise. The breakfast which was included in my room rate was more than adequete I would have no hesitation in staying in this hotel if i return to Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: shahrin
Reviews.Content: Located just a few minutes walk from the water bus station & St Marks Sq. Rooms are decorated nicely and clean. Excellent breakfast. Friendly staff.

Reviews.Title: “An excellent solution for Venice”
Reviews.Author: Gianandrea R
Reviews.Content: I've been a long-time fan of Hotel Campiello. Not only its excellent position (two steps from Saint Mark's square, and next to the boat stop), but the friendness of the staff, the optimal quality-price value, and the tidiness of the room make it a perfect choice. I forgot once my blackberry under the pillow (it had the alarm clock in it), they found it and called me half an hour later, offering to ship it. 24hrs service concierge, perfect knowledge of the city, restaurants, interesting and not known spots. Perfect, perfect, perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Location can't be beat!”
Reviews.Author: adamsam31
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed two nights in room 214 during early October. The room was listed as a triple and had plenty of space for two people. The room might be a tad small for three adults but should be fine for two adults and a child. The bathroom had plenty of space for us. Breakfast was included and was decent. As noted by others, the location is awesome. Easy two or three minute walk to St. Mark's Square. We liked the little square outside the hotel which our room overlooked and being in the heart of Venice. Very peaceful little square but still close to the action. Would definitely stay here again. Only cons were a hard bed and no wifi in room. We went down to the lobby to get free wifi. We took the Alilaguna boat from the airport. Was easy enough but took longer than I would have liked. If I had to do again, I would have just spent the extra money and hired a private boat taxi. Would recommend avoiding the weekend due to higher prices and more crowds. Make sure to wander around the back alleys at night to really appreciate Venice. Getting lost in the back alleys was one of my best experiences in Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent choice...”
Reviews.Author: rebel2NorthCarolina
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have just returned from a week's stay in the Campiello. Could not have been better for the price. First, as many have said, the location is perfect! Venice is not an easy city to walk in under the best of circumstances and hauling a suitcase is impossible! The Campiello is a straight 50 yard walk (no steps, no bridges, no crowds) from the Alilaguna boat stop at San Zaccaria which is where you get off coming from the airport. We found the staff to be very helpful and friendly, especial thanks to Marco and Dora, both of whom gave us excellent advice and guidance. Second, who cares about proximity to the madhouse of San Marco? Campiello is surrounded, just a few alleys away, with all sorts of the small bacari and osterias that make Venice worthwhile. The room we had was just fine except for no chairs, which management remedied on our request. The bathroom was clean, modern, a bit cramped, with plenty of hot water and towels. Breakfast was fine, plentiful and served until 1000. We will happily stay here again on future trips to Venice. NOTE: Nothing to do with the Campiello, but we were totally unprepared for the massive crowds of tourists, mostly Asian, that swarmed the main parts of Venice, especially Piazza San Marco and every one of the recommended sites: Accademia, Rialto, Arsenale, and every church in the city. Impossible to avoid this if you want to see the places you have read about. We were unable to get out of a shop on one occasion because of a literal phalanx of Asian tourists in a semi-military formation passing thru the alley. Remember that there are no streets in Venice, just alleys about 10' wide so be warned if you are even slightly claustrophobic. No guidebook mentioned this and it was the only drawback to our stay in this fascinating city.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but bathroom was ridiculously small and narrow.”
Reviews.Author: rmt2480
Reviews.Content: A five minute walk to San Marco makes for a great location.the room was dark but nice but the tiny bathroom was amazing at any price,let alone these prices so watch out! Breakfast was nothing special and some of the staff were nicer than others. Desk staff was fine.

Reviews.Title: “A good hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: Toni A
Reviews.Content: We were only staying one night and luckily were upgraded at no extra cost to a suite complete with living room and outside terrace. It was lovely and so convenient--just down a small street from the Grand Canal, very close to St. Mark's.

Reviews.Title: “Average but good location”
Reviews.Author: blueguaviyu
Reviews.Content: The best location, close to Piazza San Marco and Palazzo Ducale, good average and clean room. Reception helpful with directions, the room looks like one of the palazzos close by... The hotel is hard to find so when you book ask for a proper map as we were lost at the edge or the grand canal when luckily we found an angel that took us to our hotel. Good people exist in all countries.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely lovely”
Reviews.Author: mn615cat
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a junior suite and loved it. Surprised by the spaciousness and the rooms were soooo lovely. Staff was attentive and helpful. Nice breakfast. VERY convenient to St. Mark's Square.

Reviews.Title: “Like a Queen”
Reviews.Author: Svetlana M
Reviews.Content: First, be carefull looking at the photos of the room in this hotel. They have something else - much MORE interesting for you. My friend and I DID NOT expect that AT ALL!!! When we arrived in the hotel, we were asked a strange question at the reception like "Are there expecting more friends with you for the night?" - "Pardon?" - was our reaction :) The receptionist repeated the question without a smile so we understood he was not joking asking that kind of question. Actually I was even upset about that but you cannot imagine how my mood changed as soon as a lady that cleans rooms saw us off to another building. Wow! Te apartment was so light! So much room - I mean, rooms were large and there were two of them! The lady asked us if we wanted her to expand the sofe in one of the room - at last we understood the meaning of the receptionist's question - the apartment was TOO big for two of us :) ...and the bathroom... uuh! There were 2 large sinks :) The style was shick. The TVsets, a kitchen with everything you need and even more...2 comfortable beds...soft towels...what else do you want to know, my friends? You 'll be completely satisfied, believe me :) in Venice??? So much room? At such a price? Well, try and find something like this ;)

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: MariaKristjans
Reviews.Content: Very small rooms, otherwise good hotel in a great location.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, very helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: Mark_Lisbon
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Junior Suite for four nights and were presently surprised as we had been warned that hotel rooms in Venice were cramped and very hot in the high summer. Not only did we have plenty of space, but the two air conditioning units were so efficient that we only turned them on for half an hour every evening! The best thing however was the location ... you can literally see the Zaccaria waterbus stop from the hotel door a mere 50 metres away. We had to catch a 06.00 Alilaguna boat out to the airtport and felt so safe just walking down the street (well it's an alley really!) to the 'bus stop'. The hotel was very quite, even being so close to St Mark's square and the waterside.

Reviews.Title: “Great quad room”
Reviews.Author: Al P
Reviews.Content: Four of us stayed in the quad room. What an experience! The room is essentially a suite on the top floor with access to a great private rooftop terrace. Room also has a nice little sitting area. I have never stayed in a room that had so much old-world charm. Air conditioning was great and room had many comfortable blankets. Bathroom was modern and very clean. Staying in that room was a perfect end to our Italy vacation; wish we would have had more than 1 night there. Hotel Campiello was a highlight of our trip. And very easy to get to, just a short walk from the water taxi and close to St Mark's Square. Short staircase is a little narrow and winding to get to your room, but we managed even with a14 year old who was on crutches.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel & location”
Reviews.Author: Lucy F
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Campiello which had been recommended to us by family members who had stayed there in the past. The hotel is friendly, clean and in a great location - very close to St. Mark's square. The vaporetta (water bus) was only a few steps away which allowed us to easily travel around Venice and also over to Murano and to the Lido. We would definitely consider staying at this hotel again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: ejtnoot
Reviews.Content: Great room, great personel, great location! Great breakfest!!! This hotel made our trip to Venice even more impressive!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel Near San Marco”
Reviews.Author: DivyangUSA
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in August for one night before going on a cruise. this was our second stay in two years that says a lot about it. The hotel is very conveniently located near San Zaccaria Vaperetto stop and San Marco square in the heart of Venice. This time we had a regular quad room in the main building. It was nice size and comfortable. The included breakfast was basic and met our needs (We are ovolacto vegetarians). We had a renovated one bedroom apartment for our first stay in 2009 which is definitely a better value for money. You may want to book early in tourist season since the rooms tend to get booked quickly. We also received 10% discount for paying cash and mentioning Rick Steves book.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent family value in great location”
Reviews.Author: HJMR
Reviews.Content: We found this place by doing some research on the web, and it was a great spot. If you have a family the apartments just across courtyard from main hotel are an excellent value. We stayed in the largest, which was a spacious 2 bedroom, 2 bath unit with very modern fittings. The price was remarkably low for the space not to mention a quiet location 2 steps from San Marco. The front desk was extremely friendly and helpful. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “A small Hotel on a Small Campo”
Reviews.Author: tridonald
Reviews.Content: A real winner. Near St Marks Square but might as well be light years away. Situated on a quiet small square this hotel was our cozy and wonderful home for a week in Venice. The room size was ok, the bed firm and restful. The bathroom was a bit small but for Venice what else is new. Breakfasts were very nice (not quite up to memorable ones in Copenhagen) but still more than adequate. The desk personnel were very helpful with walking directions, advice on pharmacies when needed. We were allowed to leave our luggage and "hang out" while waiting to take an evening train to Budapest. All in all we would definitely recommend hotel Campiello as a great place to stay while in Venice.

Reviews.Title: “small but comfortable retreat”
Reviews.Author: giaconda-61
Reviews.Content: what a great hotel...get off the waterbus from the airport,no bridges to cross,straight down a small alleyway-even an elevator!Smallish rooms;but clean and safe. All the staff on the reception & breakfast are very courteous and helpful;I couldnt fault this location at all.Just remember to be a great tourist you have to get enough rest!

Reviews.Title: “very good hotel”
Reviews.Author: annekeHarelbeke
Reviews.Content: Very good hotel. We stayed at a studio. What a space!!!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, comfortable suite--great location!”
Reviews.Author: momof3inct
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in July 2011. My husband, me and our two teenage daughters. We had a beautiful 2 room suite with a roof terrace. The room was wonderful, clean, and spacious. The location was great---we got off the water taxi and walked one minute to our hotel. I would definitely recommend this hotel to stay in Venice and will stay again on a future visit.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location, Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: jodie_KSA
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 nights after a cruise. The location was perfect (1/2 block off the San Marcos Canal--Vaparatto stop is also right in front of the alleyway) and two bridges away from San Marcos Square. Staff was really helpful and friendly. Nice bkft every day. Wifi was slow (as it was everywhere in Europe) but free. Very clean and up to date, but nothing fancy. The mattress (as everywhere we've stayed in Europe was REALLY hard). Very nice sized room for two with extra chairs. Looked out over the open alley way that fronted the hotel. A/C was wonderful to come back to after the HOT days we had while there. Small but adequate elevator. No exercise room or spa. Didn't need to try room service.

Reviews.Title: “Great location in a beautiful city”
Reviews.Author: JN_77
Reviews.Content: We unfortunately only stayed one night, but it was wonderful. The location could not be more convenient to to the vaparetto water buses. This convenience is a major plus in a city with lots of steps and bridges and an incredibly confusing layout (that being said, the best advice I got before our visit was to spend some time getting lost away from the crowds). The breakfast buffet was generous even by American standards. The service was always polite and helpful. Free internet access is another big plus. I highly recommend their apartments. They're on the same small, quiet square as the hotel, but offer a nice reprieve in an otherwise crowded city. From our apartment we looked one way out to the main waterway and the other way to a small canal where gondoliers would occasionally float by. I would definitely stay again - and I hope I get the chance.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice!”
Reviews.Author: tats802
Reviews.Content: We only stayed 1 night and while the room was a tad small for 4 adults, it was very nice and VERY easy to find from the Vaporetto. The AC worked wonderfully especially since it was over 90 degrees while we were there. The staff were extremely helpful, the breakfast buffet was very nice. I would certainly go back.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel and great location”
Reviews.Author: drloosen
Reviews.Content: very nice room in a quiet location and close to St. Marks square and the waterfront. The hotel's location is a very short walk from the Alilaguna water bus stop. This is a big plus when arriving from the airport with luggage.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value”
Reviews.Author: Habbe7654321
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed or Venice stay and the Campiello hotel was one of the reasons. It is a very cute and extremely well situated hotel just around the corner of the famous Danieli hotel. The price is really competitive with nice rooms and a great breakfast. To take an early morning jogging trip to S:t Mark's place and then along the seashore is magical.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location, Comfortable Room, staff lacking a sense of hospitality!”
Reviews.Author: ChhayaNPaul
Reviews.Content: We have mixed feelings about this hotel. Our stay here was comfortable and the booking experience and getting there was no problem. It is located very close to St.Marks Square so you are right where all the action is. With the fantastic Vaporetto connectivity all over Venice, getting to and from this hotel was no problem. The room was large and spacious, clean and comfortable with lamps that looked like they were Morano glass... The front desk folks werenâ€™t exactly happy to see us... or so it appeared, but then they were the same way with all the residents. Cold! Yep thatâ€™s the word. They help you with what you need, but make it obvious that they are doing it coz itâ€™s their job; that feeling of hospitality and warmth is missing.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location!!!”
Reviews.Author: krisandjase
Reviews.Content: The biggest selling point of this hotel is the location!! Only about 1 min from San Marco in a little "street" which is quiet. The rooms were OK, the bathrooms were tiny though and I would advise you don't drop anything in the shower as picking it back up again was a struggle and I am a size 10!!! The staff were lovely and very very helpful. Breakfast was OK. My only complaint, but I can understand why, the room was EXTREMELY expensive for the stay (225 Euros) were as the usual price from what I can determine is about 115 Euros per night. For 115 Euros it is definitely worth it, for 225....well that is a little on the high side but there was a regatta on which pushed the prices up! The WiFi was also a bit hit and miss.

Reviews.Title: “valentines stay glad we booked here”
Reviews.Author: jasminenikita
Reviews.Content: we stayed in this hotel over febuary a stunning place just magical! :) the hotel was cleam traditional and friendly would visit again no negatives good location

Reviews.Title: “Good value, centrally located and quiet”
Reviews.Author: EliseWilkinson
Reviews.Content: I spent my 40th birthday in Venice in April 2011 with two friends. We booked the junior suite at the Hotel Campiello. The location is excellent - two blocks from St. Mark's Square, yet blissfully quiet inside the hotel. The airport water taxi and the vaporettos stop almost at the end of the street (great when you have luggage to tote around). The junior suite is very large, with an expansive living area that features a double sofa bed, a single sofa bed, and room for a rollaway bed, if needed. The room could sleep 6, if you don't mind sharing one bathroom and giving up your privacy. There is a short series of steps leading from the living room up to a private roof terrace. We loved having the terrace to sit on in the evenings and enjoy a glass of wine. There's not much of a view (all rooftops), but it's so peaceful and nice to have fresh air so close to your room. The bedroom is adjacent to the living area and separated by french doors (with an optional curtain for privacy). The bedroom can be set up as a king bed or two twins. The beds were comfortable, the sofa beds, unfortunately, were very saggy and need new mattresses. The room has a lot of charm - it appears to be part of the original attic. It features a mini-fridge, windows that open and plenty of storage. It has a/c, but that wasn't turned on since we were there in April. The only downsides to the room are that the bathroom is located in the bedroom, so if you are sharing with multiple people, they will have to walk through the bedroom to access the bathroom. Also, the room is accessed via an elevator to the 2nd floor and then climbing an extremely narrow and winding set of stairs up into the room. If you have mobility issues or are of an above average size, these stairs will likely cause you difficulty. Also note that the shower stall is very small. Not a problem for us, but we are petite in size. The front desk staff is very friendly and speaks English. I found their restaurant recommendations to be lacking (mostly sent us to sub-par tourist destinations), so do your own research before hand. English skills are very good. The breakfast and housekeeping staff, however, is harried and unhappy. That said, we received adequate breakfast service and the room was clean. Breakfast, as many have said in other reviews, is disappointing, but better than nothing. You'll get the same thing every day, never a variation. Cereals, yogurt, croissants, sliced cheese and hams, hard boiled eggs. The cappuccino was good. It's not exciting, but helpful to have something "free" to start your day when you are in such an expensive city. Free WIFI was available, although the connection in our room was spotty. The rate was reasonable for Venice. There are some less expensive hotels available, but I found the location to be very convenient, the room clean and large, and the front desk service friendly, so all in all, am happy with my choice and found it to be a good value for the money. I would stay here again, but might also consider renting an apartment to save on food costs. Venice itself is an amazing city. Enjoy your trip!

Reviews.Title: “Super location !!”
Reviews.Author: putmeontheplane
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Campiello is superbly located and our room looked over the small piazza out the front of the hotel, and if we leaned out we could see at the end of the narrow street the grand canal and the many tourists walking past, but little noise. We took a ferry from the train station when we arrived in Venice and got out at the stop after San Marco and were practically at the hotel - it truly is very very convenient and so close to charming little sidestreets and canals. We got up early on our two mornings and visited landmarks before breakfast and enjoyed being on the Rialto Bridge and in San Marco square practically on our own. The room was clean, but the decor was a little tired, and it was small, as was the bathroom, however the benefits outweighed for us these things. The bed was huge and very comfortable. One of our friends recommended this hotel for the location, and the breakfast, and although we'd agree on the location, we thought the breakfast adequate but not outstanding.

Reviews.Title: “Will come back again”
Reviews.Author: hauschka888
Reviews.Content: Stayed one day in January, not sure if 80 euro/night is quite a low-season price or not, I think it worth the $$; the best thing is its location, very very close to st marco square, water bus is in the front, takes around 40 min to the train station; the room is clean, not much feature bug enough for travellers like us.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great value”
Reviews.Author: lordiford
Reviews.Content: I was able to get an excellent deal on this hotel (much less than quoted in Rick Steve's, but it was winter) and the location was amazing for the price. Literally right between San Zaccaria and San Marco. I had a room next to the elevator which probably would suck in the busy summer, but wasn't too bad in the winter for noise level. The breakfast was fine, not stellar not terrible. The room and bath were small but clean. The shower was crazy with 11 different shower heads! Overall it was perfect for the price! Does have free internet, but it is spotty...

Reviews.Title: “Hidden Jewel”
Reviews.Author: elektra2
Reviews.Content: We were two families each with 2 adults and two kids traveling together. This was an excellent place to stay. Location could not be better, a quiet street steps from a vaporetto stop and San Marco. We had the apartment round the corner from the main hotel and our friends with the 2 older kids had the junior suite. The apartment in particular is a real treat and we had it at the same price as the suite. I was not looking forward to Venice in AUgust but this place made it worthwhile. I would go back and definitely stay at Campiello. Front desk staff was very helpful , breakfast was wholesome though you had to get there early to make the most of it. We spoke to many others who were in Venice around the same time and it seems like we had the most bang for our buck. Two thumbs up.

Reviews.Title: “Good location and Value for Money”
Reviews.Author: Beetlebug10
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Hotel Campiello from 11th - 14th December in rooms 103, 108 and 214. The single room (103) was small but adequate. the other two rooms were doubles and were well furnished, spacious and clean. There is a lift to all floors. All rooms had modern clean ensuites and heated toliwel rails, showers with ample hot water etc. We arrived into Piazzala Roma and took the No. 1 Waterbus to the second San Marco stop (about 40 mins journey and costs â‚¬6.50 per person one way ). When you disembark, the hotel is located about 1 minutes walk from pier. The hotel is also located about 5 mins stroll from St Mark's square. There are plenty of eating places very close by and a couple of bars. The hotel is good value for money and I was surprised how nice it was for the costs. We paid â‚¬70 for the double room B&B. We found eating in Venice quite expensive between cover charges, bread on tables, â‚¬4 for a cola or bottle of water. So having breakfast included in this rate was excellent. The hotel breakast was good. bread rolls, toasts, crackers, cereals, fruit, ham, cheese etc. The hot chocolate was lovely by the way!! For a few days in Venice, I would highly recommend this hotel. The only problem was on one of the mornings a work man was drilling in the building next door at 8am. But this was not the fault of the hotel. The hotel is traditional in decor and is very warm and clean. Good value and good location! I would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: JandC442
Reviews.Content: My wife & I stayed at the Hotel Campiello in September 2010 for 2 nights and had an great time in Venice. The hotel is in an amazing location. Although it is just a few minutes walk from St Mark's Square, it was very quiet around the hotel. We stayed in the Junior Suite so our room was larger than the standard accommodations, and we also had a private rooftop patio - great for sharing some wine after a long day walking around. We both recommend this nice, family run hotel. Restaurant tip: There are a lot of restaurants nearby but they can be very expensive & the quality is hit or miss. Highly recommend the Osteria Nono Risortto (spelling might be wrong). It's a bit of a walk (about 10 minutes N-W from the Rialto bridge) but is less touristy. The waitresses can look a bit grumpy (they're not really though) but the food is amazing and the daily specials are a bargain anywhere in Italy. Pros: Amazing location (less than 5 mins to St Mark's, 10-15 minute walk to the Rialto bridge); large room (Junior Suite) and updated bathroom; rooftop patio was nice, excellent, professional & friendly service; nice breakfast, possibly the best "hotel" espresso I tried in 3 weeks. Cons: Expensive, but this is Venice. The rates were really good compared to similar hotels in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Great location for the sights of Venice”
Reviews.Author: elsie18A
Reviews.Content: We have stayed in this hotel before about 2 years ago. The management seems to have changed and the hotel has merged with another, so it is much bigger now. The breakfast was pretty average and there were bugs floating in the juice which was a bit offputting!The rooms are still good, small but with everything you need. The new management are a little less friendly than previously but they were fine to deal with. The location is a few steps from St Mark's Square, near the S.Zaccaria waterbus stop. It is very quiet at night even though it is so central. We would probably stay here again as it is reasonably priced for Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Very reasonably priced hotel in great spot”
Reviews.Author: Sidneyt66
Reviews.Content: Campiello is very close to St Zaccaria vaporetto stop so very accessible - the stop is right near St Marco so frequented by vaporettos. The hotel is very cute, clean and reasonably priced for Venice. The staff are wonderful and nothing was to difficult - they made restaurant reservations for us, booked water taxi etc... all with a smile. We had a quad for 2 adults and 2 kids and it was smallish but fine - very clean and quiet. Will be staying there again next trip - we loved it. For a longer stay I would book one of their apartments.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location right next to St. Mark's Square !!”
Reviews.Author: westcoastboy
Reviews.Content: A small hotel located in a quiet street just 5 minutes walk from St. Mark's Square makes it the perfect place to see the sights of Venice. Also near to a vaparetto stop - San Zaccaria, which we caught from Piazzale Roma ( next to the bus station ) Transport is so easy on the vaparetto. But also, you can walk everywhere, it's so compact and interesting along the narrow streets turning the corner to find a church and a bridge to cross - it's a charming place ! The hotel is small, but provides everything you need for a short sightseeing trip to Venice. The room was lovely, well decorated and appointed, and a very clean bathroom providing toiletries, breakfast was continental and fine, and the reception was 24hour and staff were most pleasant and helpful. Restaurants and shops are in abundance all around. Do go inside the Basilica and Doges' Palace - they are both amazing pieces of history !! We would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent place to stay”
Reviews.Author: travelingpazs
Reviews.Content: This hotel was perfectly located a few minutes from the Vaporetto stop. We had no trouble finding it at all and loved the fact that we didn't have to carry our luggage up and down stairs. The staff was wonderful and friendly and even let us check in early. They arranged a private water taxi to take us to the airport and recommended great restaurants. We loved listening to the Gondoliers singing at night as they went by beneath our window. We weren't on the water but our room faced the little alley where there was a canal. We could hear the bells chime from St. Mark's Square..all very romantic. We thought the breakfast was great and our room was quite large, and clean. I would definitely go back. Of our 11 days in Europe, this was one of our favorite hotels. We also loved how close it was to St. Mark's. If you walk out towards the water and turn left, the next street over leads to a small square. There's a fountain there that has fresh, cold water and you can refill your water bottles. We did it several times a day for the 3 days we were in Venice. Free WiFi too.

Reviews.Title: “Super location, right next to St. Marks Square”
Reviews.Author: stylebhai
Reviews.Content: Hotel Campiello is a very convenient, affordable hotel very close to St Marks Square. it is a short 2-3 min walk from the Ferry stop, so very convenient if you have luggage. The big shopping area near St marks square is also very close by. the hotel is pretty small.. the entrance to our room was actually from outside the hotel (opening onto the courtyard). Rooms were small (typical european style) but very comfortable. The service wasnt the friendliest, but they did pack us some nice breakfast since we had an early morning departure. Keep in mind that if you have an early train to catch, this is not the most convenient hotel :) we had a 6:20 AM train out of Venice. Had to catch the 4:50 AM Ferry at St Marks Square which got us to the Venice station at around 5:30 AM or so. all-in-all, a good place to stay in Venice !

Reviews.Title: “Very nice, small hotel. Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: KVKV
Reviews.Content: Our family of 5 stayed here in August 2010. We found this to be a slightly dated, but clean and comfortable property. The location is excellent, within 5 minute walk to St Mark's Square. That made it very convenient to visit the square early in the morning before it got too busy. Contrary to other posts here, we located the hotel easily. From the S. Zaccaria water bus stop (from the airport) look toward the row of buildings and slightly to your left and you'll see the entrance down Calle de Vin. There is an easily visible sign sticking out over the door. As with all the "roads" in Venice, they are pedestrian-ways, and so it can be disconcerting to look down an alleyway rather than a big road like in other cities. Don't be put off by concerns of trying to find the hotel. Another plus of its location is that you get right of the water taxi and there are no stairs to climb or bridges to cross to get to the hotel. We saw many tourists lugging suitcases up and down stairs in Venice - not fun. The staff were very friendly and helpful. I have read a few other posts from people who were annoyed at having to ring a doorbell to get into the hotel. I think this is a good feature! It means that staff are screening who comes into the hotel. We stayed in the 3rd floor apartment. There is an elevator to the 2nd floor and then you have to carry suitcases up a narrow winding flight of stairs. Not recommended for anyone with limited mobility or strength. There was plenty of room for 5 people with a "queen" bed in a separate room (actually 2 singles pushed together) and 2 pull outs in the other room. There was one bathroom, a small fridge, a dining table. The rooms were dated . Decor is old and the carpets worn, but the room was clean. Breakfast was excellent. Same food everyday, but enough options to allow for some variety. Hard-boiled eggs, pastries, fruit, yoghurt, salami, cheese, tea, coffee, hot chocolate, juice. They offered 8% discount for cash and another 2% discount if you have the Rick Steeves travel book. I thought this hotel had very good value with a great location. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: Lain-baloo
Reviews.Content: We were in this hotel for 2 nights and absolutely loved it! The location is great with the water buses near by (which we came in from airport and the street was straight across from the stop) The staff were very friendly and helpful, the breakfast was also lovely. Our room was the perfect size for what we were looking for, only small downside was the size/layout of bathroom - in particular the shower cubicle which is very very small (I am 5ft 10 and partner 6ft 4!!) but the actual shower and water pressure was great! Our room for us in particular was great due to having some steps that folded down from the window which then led up to a small private decked terrace with table and chairs - we loved this - especially enjoying a bottle of wine at night after having dinner and stroll along along the water front! ( It is in amongst the other buildings so no view but lovely, peaceful and romantic!) We loved Venice, probably our favorite out of the cities we visited on this trip (which included florence and rome) and are definately planning to go back for a longer stay and will definately book this hotel and hopefully the same room!!

Reviews.Title: “best thing about this hotel is location”
Reviews.Author: travelfam11
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in good condition. Triple room was small for 3 people but clean. Bathroom was nice and clearly remodeled. Nice shower. Location is great. Very close to St. Mark's Square and water transportation.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, nice hotel and apartment”
Reviews.Author: goodtravelithaca
Reviews.Content: We have rented both a hotel room and an apartment. Both of them were great. The apartment was very spacious, clean, in the building next to the hotel. The hotel room was a bit small, but very nice furniture, well maintained. Most of all the hotel is 2 blocks from San Marco, nevertheless very quiet (hard to believe but true). The people at the hotel were very friendly, they responded to e-mails about booking quickly, and even gave a 10% discount for the Rick Steves book. The breakfast was fine. Overall a very good value, especially given that it is Venice and right next to San Marco.

Reviews.Title: “DO NOT STAY HERE!”
Reviews.Author: lauraboyle
Reviews.Content: I made a reservation on line to stay at this hotel. When I arrived, after searching for 20 minutes to find the hotel, off the path, the door was locked...first clue. Next, i signed the form and gave my passport for copying. The clerk said we had been "upgraded" to an apartment. Next clue. The apartment was across the alley, not attached to the hotel. It was dirty and musty and I did not feel safe there. I asked not to be upgraded and just to have the original room. NO ROOMS AVAILABLE. I was tricked. THE HOTEL GAVE AWAY MY ROOM. I did not stay here. I was furious. I still was charged! I am trying to dispute the charge. Save yourself the hassle. Stay elsewhere. We stayed at the Londra Palace and it was fantastic!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, close to main attractions and very quiet.”
Reviews.Author: 255060Chris
Reviews.Content: We have stayed here twice now. The first time was 3 years ago,when this hotel was an accidental find. We were impressed by the convenient location and closeness to the vaparetto stop at San Zacaria and San Marco Square. This made it an easy choice to rebook the same hotel this time. We travelled with 4 adult children and 2 partners. We booked 4 rooms, and all were clean and tidy. The breakfast was OK, but the same every day. The staff were polite and helpful. There are 2 very good restaurants close by, behind the hotel about a 5 minute walk. Go around the back of the hotel and then turn left and walk past shops and restaurants on the left, cross a road and then a bridge.The 2 restaurants beside the canal on the left are really good.

Reviews.Title: “A little gem”
Reviews.Author: MissMatilda
Reviews.Content: This hotel is so convenient that it's surprisingly good value. Breakfast was good, if a little sparse, staff very friendly and helpful. Our room looked nothing like the ones in the website photos but still, it was clean and comfortable and we loved the Venetian glass chandeliers. We'd stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “A WINNER”
Reviews.Author: RBMD
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a lot going for it, but location is a major plus. Located in a small alley, down from the Hotel Danielli, it is literally around the corner from St. Mark's Piazza AND an easy short walk from the Zaccharia vaporetto stop. The latter is also a major plus: one doesn't have far to go with your luggage -- and it's all a straight walk; no bridges to cross, steps to climb, etc.! The hotel is small, but the rooms, though tiny, are well appointed, clean and comfortable, and quiet. They have Wi-Fi in the lobby, and the breakfast was perfectly fine: cereal, yogurt, breads, pastries, fruit juice, fresh cofffe, cappuccino, etc. Venice is a tourist haven and the crowds can be overwhelming. The hotel, being near the Square, allows you to easily be there in the early am and the evening, before and after the mobs arrive and leave. Also, you are very close to a vaporetto spot. A good restaurant, Trattoria Revette, is also very close -- see seperate review.

Reviews.Title: “Good location for sightseeing”
Reviews.Author: laliz5
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Campiello for 2 nights. After reading the reviews we made sure to make note of how to get to the hotel. It is in a little alley that can be easily overlooked but as long as you figure out ahead of time where youâ€™re going itâ€™s easy to find. The hotel is in a great location right by the square, but at the same time is kind of in its own little area, so you donâ€™t have tons of people walking by nor do you hear a lot of noise. We found it a little weird that we had to leave our key at the front desk when we were leaving, but I guess itâ€™s nice because the staff gets to know you and you feel safe knowing that random people canâ€™t just walk in to the hotel. We went for the cheaper option and got an economy sized room. It was fine for 2 people but of course wasnâ€™t luxurious. It was definitely a small room, but we were only staying two nights and we didnâ€™t mind. If we were staying longer Iâ€™d want a bigger room. The breakfast was good, no complaints there. Iâ€™d stay in this hotel if you are wanting to see the main tourist sights of Venice, itâ€™s in a great location. If I ever went back I think Iâ€™d want to stay away from the main tourist areas. For us, two nights in Venice was enough; it was great to see such a unique city, but it was so crowded and touristy that we were ready to move on to our next city. Tip: Be sure to validate your ticket if youâ€™re taking the water bus. We didnâ€™t know we had to validate after buying a ticket. On our last day there we got caught by the staff when they were checking tickets. He gave us a really hard time and demanded 50 euros each for not having our ticket validated. He rolled his eyes when he learned we didnâ€™t speak Italian or French, so it was a frustrating experience. Somehow we luckily got out of paying the fee, so just be careful when riding public transport and be sure to validate!

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel close to San Marco”
Reviews.Author: boulderave
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a very short walk from Piazza San Marco and even closer to the vaporetto stop. Both the hotel and the hotel personnel were outstanding. An excellent value.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location -”
Reviews.Author: freddie60
Reviews.Content: Gem of a little hotel. Few minutes from St Mark's Square. Easy to reach from water bus stop San Zaccaria (2 min walk). Rooms good value for Venice. Very clean and comfortable. Only downside was service at breakfast. Get to breakfast early as food was not replenished, and service was definitely not with a smile! Take time to explore surrounding backstreets and you will find interesting little shops and good value restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “EXCELLENT VALUE FOR MONEY AND LOCATION!”
Reviews.Author: WLPOD
Reviews.Content: I recently went on a short trip to Venice whilst on a show tour going to Trieste. As an avid traveller i am used to paying low prices for poor hotels in which i sleep and I'm out and about. This hotel was AMAZING by my usual standards. It was newish, clean, modern, great staff with clever English skills as compared to my little Italian. The breakfast was great: cereals, ham, cheese, boiled eggs, juices, coffees etc but no hot food (not necessary). The hotel was in far better shape than i had read and much closer to Sam Marco square as compared to my other buddies. It was really close to San Marco and right at the ferries from the airport and other destinations at San Zacharia. I would recommend this hotel and i am recommending this hotel to friends and will come back and stay here again. Don't confuse this hotel with one of a similar name which apparently often happens and if you want large rooms don't come to Venice because they are all small no matter where you stay. My other friends in other hotels commented on the small rooms. It is excellent value for money and i really enjoyed staying here. Happy Travels! WLP

Reviews.Title: “Can't speak for the rooms, but the apartment was FANTASTIC!”
Reviews.Author: uclabruin75
Reviews.Content: Via a Rick Steves recommendation, we booked one of the apartments adjoining the hotel. You really can't beat the hotel location. It is steps off the crowded Grand Canal in a small quiet square. Vendors come by in the morning with their carts, but the noise is not excessive. The apartment fit 4 adults comfortably, had a huge bathroom and a kitchen fully stocked with utensils. It made for a wonderful visit to Venice, especially after some of the stories we've heard!

Reviews.Title: “Good Location but aint what is cracked up to be”
Reviews.Author: DavidTulsaOklahoma
Reviews.Content: I should have checked out more reviews on this hotel before booking. We took Rick Steves recommendation from his book. Bathrooms are so tiny and the shower I could barely fit in. Rooms were VERY dated and you could hear everyone else in all the other rooms. After being Venice a couple of days you figure out that it is easy to get around the whole town real easy. So do not make your room reservation because it is close to something....takes no time to get around, Be sure to check out reviews and the pictures from the hotels websites tend to embellish.

Reviews.Title: “Can't get much closer to the water taxi”
Reviews.Author: AK_Chicago
Reviews.Content: Hotel is right by St. Mark's square and the San Zaccaria water taxi stop which is a great location for dropping off your luggage then heading off for sight-seeing. We stayed in the top floor which is huge and has its own private balcony which was very nice. The decor is dated but clean. The complimentary breakfast was good - I suggest getting the hot chocolate! It was excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: jaxxmack
Reviews.Content: We stayed for one night and were given the room located next to the main door of the hotel. The room and bathroom were both very clean. Only downside was the room was very small, but it didn't bother us since our purpose was to sightsee. Again, we were only there for one night. The hotel staff were very nice and helpful. The breakfast was also good served as a buffet with the usual - cereal, croissants, rolls, ham, fruit etc.. . We booked this hotel because of the location was near St. Mark's square and the price was very reasonable. Would definatley stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: scotiagirl381
Reviews.Content: we booked this hotel based on the reviews through tripadvisor . The hotel was better than we expected. As the reviews have stated it is an ideal location near the St. Marks square, a very short walk to the vaporetto. ( S. Zaccaria vaparetto number 2 )The hotel has a lift, at least to the floor we were on, the 2nd.floor. This was our second trip to venice, we drove, so we were well prepared for packing lightly which made our arrival more pleasant. Breakfast offered several good choices. Our rooms were small, expected, clean. We were at the back of the hotel therefore quiet.

Reviews.Title: “Agree: Great location, very nice room, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Aequanimitas
Reviews.Content: Can't elaborate further on the virtually perfect location. Could not have better access to vaporetto stops. Even one night when we took a more obscure one to a remote restaurant, right there. My wife and older daughter had a nice room on the 2nd floor. Excellent beds (even the extra one), shower very nice, and free wireless internet. Staff was tremendously helpful finding some of our remote restaurants. Breakfast is functional. Typical of Europe. Coffee tasty. For half the price of the big name St. Marco hotels, could not be better.

Reviews.Title: “Quiant hotel in the heart of Venice”
Reviews.Author: ARDM42
Reviews.Content: Hotel Campiello is located steps away from the hustle and bustle of St. Mark's Square, yet it's maintains its coziness and tranquility. The staff is welcoming, the breakfast buffet is excellent, and the location just tops it all!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, but that's About it”
Reviews.Author: rufus1117
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent our last 3 nights in Italy in Venice at Hotel Campiello. The location was great, just steps from St. Marks square. However, the hotel left much to be desired. The room was extremely small, even for European standards. The room was dirty and had marks all over the walls. The decor looked like it was from the 30's, and probably had not been washed since then. The bathroom was even smaller than the room, and there was a continuous stale smell in the room. The walls were extremely thin, making it very difficult to sleep. The best part about the room was that the air conditioning as it kept our room very nice and cool during August.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent - clean, comfortable and great location”
Reviews.Author: OPL88
Reviews.Content: Great hotel. Location is perfect - near San Marco. The hotel is refurnished - air conditioning works great, everything in the room was almost new. Breakfast was very good (for the price)

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: bg19388
Reviews.Content: I loved this hotel and others reviews on this site helped me pick this hotel. It was right off the S. Zaccaria vaparetto stop which was so convenient that we didn't have to drag our luggages far. It was great that the Alliguna stop to the airport was also right by the hotel, about an hour comfortable ride to the airport from the hotel. The hotel was on a quiet street. The windows seemed soundproof. The room was large (we had a triple). The bathrrom was large and redone and beautiful, with glass shower doors. The furniture and decoration/ lighting fixtures were pretty and quaint. The front desk was very nice, helpful, and spoke English and gave out maps of Venice. The breakfast was the best one we had in Italy of all the cities we travelled to. It had meats, cereals, tea, croissants, bread, fruit, etc. Very filling and good start to day. The only negative was the "breakfast lady" flipping out on me when I wanted to take the rest of my croissant up to my room with me to eat later because I was so full. We paid a lot of money to stay there, and taking my partially eaten croissant shouldn't be a reason to get scolded at. But this was the only negative ;) The air conditioning worked great in the room...nice and cold, since it was so hot outside. The walk to St. Mark's Sqaure and the Ducale was so close. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant surprises”
Reviews.Author: seeyahale
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel is ideal, only 1 bridge to cross from the ferry terminal and 2 blocks from St Marks. We were surprised to be given an apartment just across from the hotel which was huge for our family of four including 2 children, 13 & 10. Two bathrooms was something we had not experienced in our 9 previous hotels/apartments and it was the perfect hotel to stay in for the last 2 nights of our 4 week European Adventure.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Comfortable, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: 62dante62
Reviews.Content: My travel group of 11 rented 3 of the Hotel's apartments, so I comment only on those and not any of the hotel's normal rooms. All were clean, fairly recently redone, and furnished in modern style. A bargain for Venice at about 90.00 US/pp/per night with a cash discount payment. Only complaint about the lodgings is minor - the modern style lacked a little character, but will add that the ceilings are exposed timber - I assumed the building was a formerly a stable. This lent the lodgings some charm. The bathrooms were especially nice, though the showers a bit tight - typical Europe. The apartments are right next door to the actual hotel. The hotel front desk staff were very very helpful, always friendly, and spoke English. The breakfast was perfect - cereals, yogurt, fruit, pastries, juice, and the coffee was outstanding. Loved Venice and glad I chose Hotel Campiello.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Hotel, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: PennyAustralia
Reviews.Content: My husband and I and our two children aged 11 and 7 stayed for a night in the hotel in April. When we arrived we were advised that we had been upgraded to an apartment. The apartment was absolutely gorgeous with a kitchen, two plasma TV's an enourmous absolutely stunning bathroom. It was so luxurious it spoiled us for all future accommodation. The location was perfect, very close to the ferry stop and so close to all the tourist attractions. I could not complain about a single thing and would definitely recommend this hotel to everyone visiting Venice, I doubt you could find better and at such a reasonable price.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent alternative for staying in Venice”
Reviews.Author: Beto_Rios
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel based on Trip Advisor's comments. The Hotel is in a great location since it is pretty close to St. Marks' Square and it is in front of the S.Zaccaria ACTV boat station (2 mins). The hotel is comfortable, the room was excellent, and the staff was very helpfull. The breakfast was good (I recommend the capucchino). We highly recommend staying in this hotel for your stay in Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Charming and Convenient”
Reviews.Author: creampuff09
Reviews.Content: If you want convenience to St. Mark's Square, this is a good option. It is quaint; the rooms are charming (especially the top floor suite with the roof terrace). The staff was so, so - some very helpful; others perhaps tired of tourists. This was recommended by Rick Steves and certainly worth the price and location.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location, had everything we needed!”
Reviews.Author: asuyellie
Reviews.Content: This hotel was clean, had a fantastic breakfast, and you cannot beat the location. It is one bridge away from the S. Marco vaperetto stop. Finding it was simple, and commuting around Venice was so easy from this location. We had to walk through St Mark's square to get home at night, and listening to the bands as they filled the night air with music was the perfect end to each day. The linens were clean, the towels were huge and the room was very pretty. Great shower, fully stocked bathroom. Breakfast is served in the lobby, there are lots of choices: pastries, american ham, yogurt, cereal, juices, and a server will take your coffee or hot chocolate order. We booked a quad, and though it did not look like the photo online, it was fine. There was a king bed and two twins they had brought it. We still had room to walk. Nice closets and fun Murano glass fixtures. This is a great choice. The staff helped us extend our stay by finding us a room at their sister hotel The Pagenelli, which was also up to the same standards of comfort and cleanliness. We really enjoyed our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great location close to St Marks Square”
Reviews.Author: corsw
Reviews.Content: For the money spent, this hotel was just fine. It was in a great location, just a short walk from the valparetto stop at St Marks Square. The hotel is an old converted convent. Our room was small but we reserved a double, and that's what we got. There was a pull-down staircase from our window that lead to a small private balcony, if the hotel manager had not told us about it, we never would have found it. It didn't have a view of the canal, but it was a nice little added treat. Unfortunately the weather was horrible the whole time we were there, so we were not able to take full advantage of it. The bathroom setup is quite interesting, even by european standards. There was about six inches of leg room between the toilet seat and the wall. Maybe TMI, but you had to sit sideways to use it. Not very comfortable, but doable. We too experienced the ants, but just in our bathroom. I figured it was due to the cold rainy weather and the oldness of the hotel. The breakfast buffet is really nice. Just enough to get you going in the morning. The TV offered CNN International and BBC. We paid in full at check in with cash and received almost a 20% discount off the originally agreed upon rate. Overall we found Venice very overpriced, so this hotel was a welcome respite from the expense of the city.

Reviews.Title: “great location, very accomodating staff”
Reviews.Author: hedredm
Reviews.Content: We had the economy double for 80 euro/night during Carnival, it was tiny, but they told us that. For the price, the location was perfect (right behind San Marco). What's even better was how accommodating the staff was: I got food poisoning the day we were supposed to check out, and wanted to stay another night to recover. Our room was already booked for another party, but the staff decided to give us an entire apartment suite for the exact same rate, 80 euro! The apartment was *huge* and gorgeous with a modern design. And this was during Carnival!

Reviews.Title: “Good value for Venice”
Reviews.Author: tsl1965
Reviews.Content: The hotel is wonderfully located, just behind the Doge's Palace and a 1-2 min flat walk from the San Zaccaria vaporetto stop. It is a nice little hotel and looks recently renovated. It is good value for Venice (which is exorbitantly overpriced). I booked a single room for 75 euros and was given one of their economy (i.e. small) doubles. The room was fine for me, but 2 people would have been cramped. The room was nicely furnished with large queen bed, matching bedspread and drapes, and a nice chandelier. (See photo.) Closet space was very limited, but there was a private safe. There was almost no light from outside, but the room was well lit, and they made nice use of a large mirror to give the impression of a larger room (see photo). The bathroom was quite narrow, but there was nice toiletries and plush towels. The only public spaces are the nice breakfast area, a very small bar, and a small lounge. There is a free computer terminal for email / internet access. Breakfast consisted of a fresh baked croissant, some bread, cereal, juice, coffee - nothing special but nicer than many Italian hotels. Again, a nice little hotel and good value for Venice - if you want more room, pay extra for a standard or superior double - the rooms are quite uneven in size.

Reviews.Title: “Lots of ants”
Reviews.Author: dkbexpat
Reviews.Content: Chose this hotel based on a Rick Steve's recommendation. We had a 2 bedroom apartment which was very nice. The only problem is that it was filled with tiny ants. We even found ants in our bed in the morning. I told the gentleman at the front desk about the ants and he really didn't seem to care. Other than the ants the hotel was fine.

Reviews.Title: “Very Loud Hotel”
Reviews.Author: hj232
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a nice staff, a great location near St Mark's--but it was the loudest hotel room I have ever attempted to sleep in. The maids would be in the hallway around 0600 dropping bags of linen on the floor and banging doors and then at night there would be guys outside in the courtyard smoking and joking until around midnight. It wouldn't be a big deal but the sound came right through the walls. There is also a sotrage room for wine under the hotel rooms. Thus, you hear bottles clanking throughout much of the day. Lastly, we stayed at three hotels in Italy and this one had the most uncomfortable bed of the three. I think you can probably do better in Venice. Ciao!

Reviews.Title: “Loved this place!”
Reviews.Author: Chica-linda
Reviews.Content: Stayed here twice, in 2000 and then again in 2004. It was a great place, due to location, service and cleanliness. Made our time in Venice super fun!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent!”
Reviews.Author: terenceong
Reviews.Content: Excellent stay. Stayed in the apartment. Very clean and spacious. There were four of us. The apartment we stayed in had 2 bathroom/toilets, a bedroom with 4 beds, kitchen and a living area equiped with a dining table. It was fantastic! And the location made it even better. It is within walking distance to saint marco's plaza. Would certainly go back. And the breakfast was more than adequate.

Reviews.Title: “Charming hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: shoppit
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Campiello for three nights in mid-May 2008. It is a charming hotel with a lobby and breakfast room on the ground floor and 14 guest rooms split between the first and second floors. It is located on a quiet alley one block from the Grand Canal, two blocks from Saint Marks Square and a one minute walk from the San Zaccaria vaporetto boat stop (hint â€“ if you purchase the 72 hour vaporetto pass for 31e at the airport, it includes a ride on the #5 bus from the airport to the main vaporetto terminal). Our room, #214, was large and comfortable, with exposed ceiling beams and two opening windows facing the alley. Amenities included a large comfortable double bed, full dresser, closet armour, two nightstands, desk, two chairs / folding beds, sitting table, room safe, 13â€� TV and a refrigerator. The bathroom was small, but easily accessible. The TV did not work when we arrived and we blew a circuit breaker that took a half hour to locate, but otherwise had no issues with the room. The breakfast buffet was fresh, tasty and the best of all of the Italy hotels we stayed at, including hard boiled eggs, two sliced meats, sliced cheese, three cereals, assorted fruit, red and yellow orange juice, toast, croissants, coffee and tea. Either the room doors or hall facing walls were very thin, as I could easily hear people in other rooms talking and showing, yet I heard nothing once inside my room. Note that while they claim to provide free internet access, it means they have one oldish computer in the lobby that you must wait for; they do not provide wired or wireless access otherwise. Two of the front desk daytime staff, Thomas and Davide, were extremely knowledgeable and provided many helpful tips from museum reservations to vaporetto schedules to restaurants. Unfortunately, I had to deal with a problem back home in the US, which was compounded by the ineptitude of the evening staff. Marco told me that none of my expected calls came in, which I later learned was not true, and Mario dropped my call while I was waiting in the lobby at midnight, then laughed and said that theyâ€™ll call back. In summary, we enjoyed our stay at the Hotel Campiello and would not hesitate to return. It is in a perfect location, quiet, well maintained and an excellent value for the price we paid.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel (Apartment)”
Reviews.Author: LongIslandFlan
Reviews.Content: This review relates to the apartments that families stay in at Hotel Campiello which are located right next door to the main hotel. As such, I can't comment on the service or the rooms at the Hotel as I did not experience it. However, I can comment on my stay in the apartment and it was fantastic. We were 4 (two adults and two kids (8 and 13)) and the apt was perfect. Small kitchen and eating area that saved me a fortune -- all meals but for two were from the grocery store (sandwiches, olives, cheese, fresh bread and fruit). In fact, the breakfast in the hotel was not as good as the breakfast I got from the local stores. The apt included two separate areas for sleeping and a giant bathroom. The room was beautiful and clean. The location of this Hotel is perfect. A five minute walk from San Marco and one minute from the water taxi. I wasn't thrilled with the staff as they pushed a Murano Glass tour on us, over and over, until we finally gave in. What a travesty and waste of time. The concept that a hotel I was paying good money to went out of its way to funnel me to a complete and utter rip off, really upset me. But once I got back to my spacious room I felt a lot better (clearly the staff gets $$ from the tour). Don't go on the Murano trip as the prices are higher than in Venice and while the boat trip there is free, there ain't no way back but by water taxi, which is very slow and isn't free. Getting ripped off is one thing, but losing precious hours in Venice is inexcusable. But for the Murano experience, I loved Venice. There was some flooding but it was part of the charm. If you go knowing you're going to pay high prices and everyone is looking to rip you off, you can deal with it and enjoy the city which is spectacular. Gelatto at night on the Plaza with your kids listening to the battling orchestras is priceless, even if it does cost you $50 for a seat and a coffee. Now that I think about it, it may have cost me 50 Euro, but it was still worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Apartments were INCREDIBLE”
Reviews.Author: Diana13
Reviews.Content: We booked directly from David at the hotel over the phone and through email. There were two couples so we decided to save some money and stay in the apartment. When we arrived, our jaws dropped at how incredible this place was. The apartment itself was completely redone two yrs ago and everything was contemporary and had everything you could want (a doorbell which we loved). There is an enormously long hallway and two full baths (one with a hot tub). The bathrooms are HUGE and gorgeous. The master bedroom is so big you could probably fit 15 people in there and be comfortable. There's a walk-in closet and a safe in there. Two couples can stay here and not even hear the other one because this place is so big and even has a kitchen with silverware, plates, cups, pots, tea, etc. The apartment is literally 5 seconds from the actual hotel and the buffet breakfast is in the main hotel. We had family stay in the main hotel and it was just okay. The rooms were small but everything seemed clean. If you have a chance, definitely book the apartment. When we were there, it was only 10 Euros more than a room at the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A lovely little place”
Reviews.Author: Andrea005
Reviews.Content: This was a wonderful place to stay, so close to the Vaporetto stop & a short walk to St Marks, and yet down a quiet little alleyway, with no noise at night. The room we had wasn't huge, but was well laid out & fine for me & my mother for 4 nights. Very clean and modern throughout, excellent service. Breakfast was simple â€“ cereal, ham, cheese, eggs croissant etc, but perfectly pleasant & very nice coffee. We asked for recommendations for somewhere to eat & they booked us a table at a local restaurant (Trattoria Gardinetto) for our last night â€“ I wouldnâ€™t recommend doing the same, as it was overpriced and very poor service. Apart from that, would definitely use this hotel again & wouldnâ€™t hesitate to recommend it to others.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: Silverpablito
Reviews.Content: Booked the Campiello direct and paid 130 Euros per night. For Venice in this location, this is very reasonable, about 300 yards from St Mark's Square. The hotel is less than 100 yards from the San Zaccaria vaporetto stop. We flew into the Marco Polo airport. In the concourse you can buy a three day pass for the vaporetto's (canal buses) for 31 Euros. The price includes the number 5 bus to Venice. When you arrive on the bus, take a short walk down to the Grand Canal and get the number 1 or 2 vaporetto (you are not allowed on number 3, for locals only.) The number 1 vaporetto is slow and stops at every stop. The number 2 stops at about every third stop. Try and get one of the front seats and enjoy the trip down the canal. A great way to arrive. The hotel is very clean and we thought a reasonable three star. The bathrooms are very small but functional for one person at a time. No bath but a very nice shower that you could either wash normally in or get blasted by about ten jets.
