Our room was quite big although we did hear other guests complaining about the size of their rooms. These seem to be Americans who are used to everything being big it seems. There is a room safe and the room was cleaned very well each morning. Breakfast was the usual continental with croissants, bread, cereal, fruit, yoghurt, cold meat, cheese etc. Something for nearly everyone and you could set yourself up nicely for the day. Tips for travellers to Venice Venice is quite expensive, especially with the exchange rate at 1.23 to the pound. If you are up for getting of the beaten track a bit you can still eat and drink reasonably well at not too much cost. If you pop into a local bar (ostaria) you can get a glass of wine or coffee for two or three Euros. If you sit outside at a table in a tourist area it will be double that and four times in St Marks square. We did a number of walks in one of the guide books. If you wish to visit lots of the churches it is worth buying a chorus card for 8 Euros. This gets you into many places that otherwise charge upwards of 2.5 Euros each to go into. If you walk off the beaten track you will find reasonably priced restaurants. We had lunch at a couple. Pizza or pasta with salad and bottle of wine for 35 Euros for two. Restaurants are generally more expensive than Tratorrias but they all have menus outside so you can look at the prices. Bear in mind that most charge a cover charge of two to five Euros for bread and often a service charge of 12%. Hors D'oeuvres are expensive and if money is tight, just have a main course. Some restaurants do a set menu of two or three courses. Expect to pay at least 80 to 100 Euros for a three course meal with wine and you can pay a lot more. The best restaurant we found was the Da Remigio, not far from the Campiello hotel at Salizzada Dei Graci, Costello 3416. Really good fish restaurant used by a lot of locals. You will need to book, so get up there the day before or lunchtime.

Reviews.Title: “Great Apartments conveniently located to St. Mark's Square”
Reviews.Author: CarolynAZ
Reviews.Content: We had booked a quadruple room and were upgraded, at no charge, to a fabulous and modern apartment which they have just recently added to their accomodations. The apartment had a kitchen, an American Size resort bathroom, a living room with comfy fold out couch and a master bedroom. Included with our room was a very complete continental breakfast in the main hotel (just steps from the apartment). This place has an exceptional location that could probably only be exceeded by a canal view. You are just moments away from the vaparretto stop and very short walk to St. Marks and the Doge' Palace. Definitely recommend the Hotel Campiello as an excellent value with a great location.

Reviews.Title: “Smart hotel, good location”
Reviews.Author: Monty0
Reviews.Content: We had a lovely room for our first night at the hotel. We were impressed by the decoration, the cleanliness and facilities. However, when we arrived back on the second day, we found we had been moved. We went to the reception and were told that this information had been given to us in an email, although nothing was said when we arrived, so we assumed (as we had booked on line and then cancelled, and gone direct to the hotel that the reason for a change in room would have been removed as we had freed up a room). We were disappointed at this, the second room was smaller and we hadn't liked the thought that hotel staff had moved our things. However, apart from this which was unfortuate, the hotel is a good find and we only paid 180 euros for two of us for two nights which seemed a bargain when compared to most other hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Charming with a Great Location!!!”
Reviews.Author: viajeelmundo
Reviews.Content: We decided to stay here based on Rick Steve's book and we are glad we did. The owners were very friendly and helpful. All of their local restaurant recommendations were great. We stayed in Room #215 which is on the 3rd floor - don't worry there is an elevator/lift. The room was very clean and the bathroom was large for European standards. It also looked brand new. The room had antique Venetian decor. Our room did not have a view - just the view of other buildings. The breakfast buffet was standard. The hotel is literally about 80 meters from San Zaccaria ferry stop. The hotel is a short 2-4 minute walk from San Marco Square and all the other sights are max a 10 minute walk. It really is located near everything which made it convienent to stop in our room if we ever needed anything.

Reviews.Title: “fabulous”
Reviews.Author: suekush
Reviews.Content: This place was perfect for our two families (ten people in all). The rooms were attractive and clean, the continental breakfast was fabulous with fresh fruit, meats, croissants and wonderful cappucino and hot chocolate. The handsome young owner (with his mother and aunt) was always friendly and helpful with directions, his favorite restaurants, etc. When he was at the desk, I felt I was coming home. The courtyard outside the hotel was perfect for the kids to wait for the adults to get ready and play soccer ! The location of the hotel is perfect. Minutes from St. Mark's and the vapparatto, yet not in an excessively touristy area. And the price is great, too.

Reviews.Title: “More than expected!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Allie07
Reviews.Content: We stepped off the water taxi into the hussle and bussle of the centre of Venice and our hotel was literally a two minute walk away. Like many of the hotels in this area, Hotel Campellio is located down a narrow street. It looks small and run down from the outside and the reception area is basic enough. However, the attitude and helpfulness of the staff was amazing. They were extremely welcoming and helpful. We didnt actually stay in the hotel, we stayed in one of the hotel apartments around the corner from the hotel. We cannot comment on the rooms in the hotel but we would seriously recommend the apartment accommodation. It was spotlessly clean. Air conditioned. Loads of room. Security safe in room. The bathroom was immaculate and very spaciuos. The location of this hotel is perfect. It was very peaceful at night. There was alot of activity early in the morning outside the aprtment and the noise level was high, but it wasnt off putting as we were getting up early anyway. We really enjoyed our stay in Hotel Campellio apartment. The rate was reasonable and we would go back there in a flash. We would highly recommend the Hotel Campellio Apartment accomodation and give the hotel, location, price, staff etc 10 out of 10. Loved it!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Big mistake!”
Reviews.Author: damario
Reviews.Content: I never did write a review of this hotel, as I don't really like to be negative...perhaps we just wanted to forget the experience, our only bad one. But after having just read a glowing review, I thought I should share ours so that people will be encouraged to look elsewhere since there are other options! After THOROUGHLY researching hotels through books, this site, Fodors.com, Venere, etc. we settled on Hotel Campiello, mainly because it was available, it wouldn't break the bank, could sleep a family of four, and was close to Piazza San Marco. We were stunned by the weird, rude behavior of the blonde guy at the front desk upon our arrival, and every other time we attempted to interact with him. This was the last leg of our wonderful 15 day trip to 5 destinations in Italy, and this was the only hotel that was a huge let down. That particular man rolled his eyes whenever we asked him for a bit of advice (we soon stopped). He was extremely arrogant. Another man with dark hair appeared friendly, but was not there long. Twice in our 4 days there we observed a blonde woman who may have been the proprietor...she seemed equally arrogant. It was very odd, as all of our other hotel experiences had been lovely. Additionally, the hotel room was tacky, and the shower stall almost impossible. Though the breakfast was good, we always noticed that they would not replenish the little buffet, even though it was well before the time breakfast was to end. Wished we had stayed in one of the other hotels we selected in the past!

Reviews.Title: “March 12th-14th, 2007”
Reviews.Author: CharAT
Reviews.Content: Clean, quite, english speaking, pretty easy to find after taking the water-taxi, Close to San Marco Square, would stay there again. Public water-taxi for transportation was fine, private taxi's WAY to expensive. Gondola rides around 80-120 eruos.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient, nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: shellaChicago
Reviews.Content: My family of 3 enjoyed this hotel for 2 nights in March, 2007. The room was very small but clean. The bathroom looked like it was recently renovated, but also quite small. The hotel is conveniently located near St. Mark's Square, but we found it better to dine away from the main tourist areas. We made a mistake the first night and ate a ristorante near the hotel called da Roberto Ristorante--the service charge AND cover charge were not included so it appeared that the dinner prices were fair..until you realized the extra charges! The food was mediocre to say the least. It was our worst meal of our trip! We had a room towards the back of the hotel so outside noise was not an issue. I did get a few mosquito bites as we needed to open our windows at night. The breakfast buffet was satisfactory and the staff was polite. The price was definitely fair - E120 per night for a triple room.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: Stansworth
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a great location near St. Marks, plus the room was great. Not opulent, but still Old World feel w/o the dingy feel of some other "Old World" places. Big exposed timbers in the ceiling for example were a nice touch. We were surprised to find our room had a private terrace with stairs accessed by opening one of the big windows! Very Venice! Anthony was great - made restaurant reservations for us, gave some water taxi tips, and was generally very helpful and pleasant. Breakfast was fine - selections of cereal, eggs, bacon, pastries, yogurt, fruit - enough to get us started each day. Bathroom was upscale -marble, great fixtures - but tiny. If you are over 250 lbs make sure to request a larger bathroom! Book from the hotel directly - just send them an email from their web-site! We booked ~12 weeks in advance. - Austin, TX

Reviews.Title: “Charming Hotel, good location”
Reviews.Author: DebbieB23
Reviews.Content: This is a charming hotel in a small alley just steps from St. Marks Square. I think this is a perfect location for first time visitors, or people staying only a night or two. The San Zaccaria vaporetto landing is a short walk away, where you can get any boat, up the Grand Canal or out to other islands or to the airport. Having seen more of Venice this time, there are less touristy areas in the City that I would like to stay in next time. Many of the better local restaurants are not near St. Marks at all. That said, the hotel was small but lovely. We booked a standard double, and the management said it would be tiny, and they were right. The bathroom was fine though, and there was a decent breakfast in the morning. People were friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel in Venice”
Reviews.Author: DSCmePleasanton_CA
Reviews.Content: We (a family of 4) stayed at the Hotel Campiello, based on Reviews. It is a nice hotel however, not the best of the best as some have suggested. We stayed at better hotels in Italy. The Good: Rooms are well appointed. The hotel is very easy to reach via Water Bus. Located in a great location near St Marks Square. The not so good: Notice I didnâ€™t say bad. Because there was nothing â€œbadâ€� about this hotel except the .5 lb key we had to drag around. The room locks are not updated to electronic key-cards and use standard keys attached to the biggest key-chain you ever saw. The standard key entry when you have your kids staying in another room makes you a bit nervous. The hotel staff was helpful but not overly friendly and certainly didnâ€™t go out of their way to make our stay in Venice more enjoyable. Donâ€™t show up early for breakfast and expect a smile or even any attention from the breakfast staff. All in all it is a decent hotel but nothing to rave about.

Reviews.Title: “A very nice hotel in Venice”
Reviews.Author: mw400
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Campiello (Castello 4647, Campiello del Vin, 30122 Venezia, Tel: ---) in Venice during our anniversary trip through Italy in May, 2006. Hotel Campiello is conveniently located. The hotel staff was very polite and helpful. Our room was very nice, clean, airy and pleasantly decorated. We did not experience any mosquito in our room. The hotel has a free Internet computer allowing us to check our emails conveniently. The breakfast was substantial and there always were several staff members while we were there. We definitely recommend Hotel Campiello for travellers wanting to enjoy a convenient and pleasant place to stay whilte visiting Venice, Italy.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: ociene
Reviews.Content: We were so incredibly impressed by Hotel Campiello. We stayed for 3 nights in May/June, and absolutely loved it. The staff are very nice; while we had some minor issues communicating in English with one of the women, we found Thomas to be frequently available and amazingly helpful (we actually wound up nicknaming any other helpful person we ran across in Italy from then on Thomas2, Thomas3, etc)! They helped us book a Vivaldi concert, tried to help us book the secret itineraries tour (it was full), even loaned us wine glasses from the small bar one night when we brought a bottle of wine in with us. We also always received a response to any email we sent beforehand (and we had many questions) within 24 hours, which really helped us with planning. The staff just made it so nice. Our room was very small, but since we had been forewarned of that by Thomas when we made the booking (we booked a budget room), this was fine and still completely adequate on space. The bathroom was small but great; I've never seen such a fancy shower setup, with a whole wall of functions! For the price, it was wonderful. Plus when we checked in they noted that we had the Rick Steve's travel book and gave us a 10% discount for paying cash, which was very appreciated. You can't beat the location, either. From St. Mark's square you cross 2 canals (the first has the bridge of Sighs on it) and the the hotel is on the next alley - about 5 minutes walk total. The Rialto area was easily found by going to St. Mark's and following signs, too. We could actually see the water when we leaned out our window too. The noise in the morning was a bit of an issue, as the souvenir salespeople pushed their carts by the hotel (it sounded like glass milk jars clanging together), but we got used to it and it wasn't bad when we shut the window and turned on the AC. Breakfast was good, too - cold meat and cheese, cereal, fruit, and yogurt, plus they'd give us fresh bread and bring coffee, tea, or cappaccino to our table. The lobby area where you eat is very prettily done as well. We wished they had a secure luggage storage area there but felt safe enough leaving our suitcases there for a few hours the day we checked out. The decorations were pretty overall, and we liked the chandelier lighting in our room. Overall, Venice was a wonderful place to be, and staying at the Hotel Campiello made it even better. I've already started recommending it to friends!

Reviews.Title: “A Wonderful Place To Stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: An excellent hotel in an excellent location! My 4-day stay was perfect: the staff was polite and helpful, the room clean, the bed good, the shower excellent, complimentary breakfast fine, and the A/C in my room worked well. The location just SW of St. Mark's piazza is very handy, with S. Zaccharia boat bus stops at end of the street and easy walking access to many areas beyond St. Mark's. I would definitely stay here again and recommend it to you.

Reviews.Title: “Venetian Oasis”
Reviews.Author: Christina78
Reviews.Content: Hotel Campiello is a comfortable, clean, quiet, small hotel with a great location in the heart of Venice. It was an easy to walk to the hotel (even with our suitcases) from the public transportation (vaporetto)stop. The hotel was located off of an alley off of the Riva degli Schiavoni waterfront promenade. The alley (like most in Venice) did not feel at all intimidating, even late at night. The owners and their desk employees were very friendly (always smiled to buzz you in the front door). Breakfast was good, and included ham, boiled eggs, cereals, fresh baked goods and coffee or hot chocolate. We had a small garden balcony off of our room - we kept the windows open most of the time as the temperature in October was quite comfortable. The room was small, really just like a bedroom rather than what we would think of as a hotel room, but it really was just fine since we spent most of our time out wandering the streets of Venice. We would not hesistate to stay at hotel campiello when we return to venice.

Reviews.Title: “Dishonest Bait & Switch!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: On Feb. 2, I contacted Hotel Campiello to inquire about price for a 4-night stay in August, and I was offered a single room for 63 Euro per night. TWO WEEKS LATER, when I attempted to accept that offer, Hotel Campiello stated that its original offer expired after one week and offered me a single room for the same time period for 80 Euro per night (a 20% increase) instead! The original offer did not say anything about expiring after a certain amount of time, and I seriously doubt that in one week, there was a dramatic change in the availability of single rooms in August, which is still 6 months away!! This was a classic bait and switch, and reflects a serious lack of integrity.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location, a real find”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed for two nights in January after flying in with Ryanair to Treviso, then taking the airport bus to Piazza Roma. The hotel is easy to get to from the bus station. The number 41 boat takes 15 mins to the main vapretto stop (S.Zaccaria)and a 2 min walk, past the Bridge of Sigh's. the hotel is located in an alley called Calle De Vin. We arrived at 12am and there was a night porter there who gave us a key and was happy for us to go out again and have a look around Venice at night. The room was spotlessley clean and warm as it was freezing outside. As it is located down an alley it was also silent at night. It was adequete for our needs and we felt it was worth the 140EURO we paid for two nights. Breakfast was the usual continental selection of cereal, toast, meats, cheeses...etc. We could not fault the hotel and the recomendation we were given for an evening meal was excellent. One tip is to turn right out of the hotel and explore the backsteets instead of going left and along the front to S.Marco. All in all a real hidden treasure, excellent location, friendly helpful staff, we would definetly stay there again if we visited Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Great for first time in Venice”
Reviews.Author: jetsetMar
Reviews.Content: Location: The location is prime, especially if this is your first time in Venice, like it was for us. From the airport, we took a vaparetto to the San Zaccaria stop, the one before San Marco Square. When we arrived at our stop, we looked for Campiello de Vin and it was right there. Not even a 2-minute walk from stop. Itâ€™s in a quaint and quiet hidden square. Think rolling suitcases. It was perfect. Everything was walking distance, especially San Marco Plaza, over 2 bridges and you are there in less than 2 minutes. Rooms: The room was small however clean and comfortable. I guess thatâ€™s the European standard. The bathroom was standard and if youâ€™ve ever cruised before, the shower was the size of one you find on a cruise ship. Service: A nice breakfast was included in our price; a good start for the day. Free internet too. During the times we were out of the room, we interacted with Thomas and he was very sweet. He reserved opera tickets for us and recommended a couple of restaurants that were very good. Overall: It was a good pick since we were in Venice on our honeymoon for 2 nights and hardly ever in the room. We paid 110 euros and it was worth it. (Remember December is low season and cold) We would stay here again and definitely recommend this hotel for a short stay in Venice.

Reviews.Title: “A Little Piece of Venice”
Reviews.Author: LetsGoTravelin
Reviews.Content: This small Hotel was reasonably priced, by Venice standards, for it's excellent location and very Venetian styled rooms. Our room was a small double with a very nice bathroom. It too, was warm and we opened our window and the mosquitos made themselves at home. The breakfast room is small, but the breakfast was tasty. The online service was "out of order" when we were there. The front desk staff was very kind and helpful. We would stay again, but upgrade to a larger room.

Reviews.Title: “Great location near St Marks”
Reviews.Author: tsatl
Reviews.Content: The location was the best selling point for this small hotel. Near St Marks and the water taxis. The accomodations we nice but a little noisy in the AM as many vendors were passing in front (small alley/street)of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed Review”
Reviews.Author: curiousatny
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hotel Campiello for 3 nights in mid October. The hotel is very conveniently located- close to Vaporetto stop and near Plza San Marco. The hotel is physically uninviting, with no public lounging space, and the breakfast area is in the samll front lobby. (the breakfasts are good and generous). I had a single room for 2 nights, which was shabby, not overly clean, and noisy, since it overlooked the small street. (Little did I know that deliveries were made by noisy carts at around 6am daily. Couldn't close the shutters b/c it was too too hot, since the heat was on despite the warm outside temperature.) The last night I had a small double room which was considerably nicer and quieter, but could still hear all hallway and other room sounds. The price was reasonable by Venice standards. The front desk staff not overly solitious but helpful when asked. The on site owner should pay more attention to detail.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and a safe choice”
Reviews.Author: Geoff555
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 2 nights over UK half term week taking advantage of the cheap Ryan air flights to Treviso. The hotel is easy to get to from the bus station (41 boat takes 15 mins and a 2 min walk) and the hotel staff were very helpful with directions, room was clean and tidy but only a small bathroom with a shower. Breakfast was very generous and overall we were very pleased with the choice of the hotel (paid 300Euro for 2 nights). The location was great- only 200metres from St Mark's. Only one complaint - in late Oct they turn off the A/C and start heating the hotel up. Even with the heater off and window open it made for a sweaty night where I became a good meal for the last of the season's mosquitos...ouch!

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed the Campiello”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were on vacation in Italy last month (August 2005) for our honeymoon. We decided to take a side trip to Venice for one night and so we booked the Campiello online last-minute (the day before we went). The location is excellent -- extremely close to the Vaporetto stop and a quick 2-minute walk to Piazza San Marco. There is an elevator and a breakfast room. It is a small hotel with fairly small rooms, but they aren't too tiny - our room had two twin beds pushed together, a wardrobe, a chair, side tables and a writing desk. The room was clean and the English-speaking staff were very pleasant and helpful. We had a great time in Venice and enjoyed the Campiello.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Campiello!”
Reviews.Author: sappel54
Reviews.Content: We recently returned from a 3 night stay at the Campiello (part of a three-city Italy vacation), and cannot recommend it highly enough. Of course, Venice is a magical city, but the location of the Campiello added immensely to the experience. It is right off the water, literally just steps from a Vaporetto stop (the Venice waterbus system). However, it is situated down a quiet little street, so you can leave the noise and bustle of the Canals behind you when you check in. The rooms are average sized by European standards, nicely furnished and spotlessly clean. Venice is a walking town, and the location helps here, too. It is right around the corner from the Piazza San Marco and the Duomo. The evening walk back across the plaza, listening to the bands playing, on the way back to the Hotel was unforgettable. The staff is attentive and helpful, and the included Continental breakfast is a nice way to start the day. We loved our stay there. Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Quiet Alley Charmer”
Reviews.Author: WeRTravelers
Reviews.Content: My family and I (me, husband, 11 yr old and 9 yr old) stayed at the Campiello in late July of this year. What a great location! Right off the San Zaccharia stop, just a few minutes from San Marco...and yet very quiet and serene. The hotel has just 20-25 rooms and yes, the rooms are not terribly imaginative, but the service is excellent (some of the staff speak very little English, though, so be prepared). They even booked our "Secret Itineraries Tour" at the Doge's Palace for us. Breakfast is great (typical Italian fare...we got addicted to having prosciutto and salami at all times of day). Our quad room was large enough that we weren't stepping on eachother: a queen bed and two small twins, but the bathroom could have been a tad bigger. Not a big deal. Nothing would keep us from going back and staying at the Campiello again (although we will visit Venice in Spring or Fall next time -- it was VERY hot and crowded in late July). Our favorite part of the hotel's location was that if you turn right out of the entrance (instead of left toward the water), you found all sorts of wonderful, mysterious back alleys to explore. No crowds!

Reviews.Title: “Ok hotel, not really for business”
Reviews.Author: pinkmonkey
Reviews.Content: This hotel was very conveniently located for all the sights and also the waterbus. I found the staff there were excellent - very helpful indeed and there is free internet access which is unusual for a hotel of this kind. My room was tiny and shabby - a double bed with about a foot of space around it and peeling wallpaper. I think this hotel is better suited to tourists than business persons - I had to miss breakfast every day due to it starting too late for me, because had early meetings. There was no desk or table in the room so I could only work on my laptop with difficulty. Final point of note - avoid the restaurant right outside the hotel. I had a glass of wine, some calamari and a lasagna, which were of 'transport cafe' quality and it cost a whopping 38 euros!

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel Campiello
HotelInfo.Address: Campiello del Vin, Castello 4647, 30122 Venice, Italy
